topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f88c6f6368723c684f0700#post_54f88c6f6368723c684f0700
Season 3 they butchered the budget and it showed A LOT.
I only watched the first third of season 4 but from what I've seen it seems to suffer the same problems the digimon movie had; I know that's a weird analogy to make, but what I mean by this is that the individual parts of it were fairly decent but the director for some reason had essentially 3 different movies crammed together with a essentially a single piece of tape.  If you're going to have a long story arc then have a long story arc, don't just tape them together going "I make epic now".  The individual episodes of season 4 are good, but the individual parts of something do not make it as a integrated whole good.

Tl:dr; season 3 had budget cuts; season 4 tried too hard to convince people it was a deeper underlying story.

topics.body:
Hope no one minds, but I just wanna share something with you all, if thats ok.

Back in January, while I was taking care of the house and the family dogs, I found a lump on the back of the older dogs neck, very near where he wears his collar, I told my mother about the lump as soon as she came home, and of course, we went to the vet the next day to see what it was. Fast forward to last wednesday, where our dog went in to have surgery to have the lump removed, when he was ready to return home, we were told that the vets would have to check if the lump they removed was cancerous, and if it would cause further health issues.

Today we got a phone call from our vet saying they got the tests back and the lump that was removed was a benign tumour, which could have developed into a very agressive form of cancer due to where it was, and if it didn't it could have potetially grown and started blocking an important blood vessal, so if I hadn't found the lump when I did, our dog would have some very major health problems in the future.

topics.body: Was it made after? Does it play traditional super robot tropes strait? then it's likely that it was indeed meant to respond to eva because like it or not everything super robot since then has been made with eva in mind somehow, either to study what worked, copy it, reconstuct what it deconstructed and the like,
